disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about laser removal of microblading, a semi-permanent eyebrow tattoo technique using fine hair strokes. Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner.

Consider options carefully, seek second opinions, ask questions. Laser (Q-switched or Pico) targets pigment in the superficial dermal layer, fragmenting it for immune clearance; numbing applied first. Sessions 15-30 minutes, 4-10+ treatments 6-8 weeks apart; complete removal not guaranteed, varies by pigment (iron oxide may darken), skin type, age.

Gradual fading; avoid sun 4 weeks pre/post with SPF 50+, no makeup/picking scabs. Informed of practitioner/location per session, withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: pain (snap sensation), redness, swelling, blistering, crusting, scabbing, itching (1-2 weeks). Less common: infection (poor aftercare), hypersensitivity/allergic to pigments (mercury/cobalt/chromium), pigment oxidation (darkening gray/black), hyper/hypopigmentation (darker skin higher risk).

Rare: scarring, textural changes, hair follicle damage/thinning, eye irritation if unprotected. Contraindications: active infection, recent sun/Accutane (6 months), photosensitizers, keloid history.

I understand procedure reasons, risks (of doing/not), personal risks, benefits, alternatives (saline, cover-up), uncertainties, follow-up.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: Authorize photos/videos for records.

Certify read/understood form, questions answered, consent given.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
